titleInfo.title: DeMonbrun v. Stevens Transport
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 2 Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis subject to the admonitions stated above in this Order. The Clerk of Court shall send the plaintiff a summons and a Form-285 together with a copy of this order. The Marshal shall serve the summons and complaint without payment of costs or fees. Plaintiff shall obtain service on a defendant within 120 days from the filingof the complaint. The plaintiff shall keep the court informed of his current address at all times while the case is pending. Signed by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett on 8/9/2006. One summons form and one 285 form sent to plaintiff. (JAE, ) Modified on 8/11/2006 to add Magistrate (DKM, ).

titleInfo.title: DeMonbrun v. Stevens Transport
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 6 and 7 Motions to Amend Complaint. Going forward the complaint shall consist of filing 1 as amended by filing 7. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JSF)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting 6 and 7 Motions to Amend Complaint. Going forward the complaint shall consist of filing 1 as amended by filing 7. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JSF)

titleInfo.title: DeMonbrun v. Stevens Transport
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER that by November 17, 2006 Plaintiff shall provide to the court copies of all charges and claims brought by the Plaintiff to the NEOC or EEOC and all Commission Determinations, Right to Sue Letters, or any other communications Plaintiff received from the NEOC or the EEOC. The Clerk of Court shall send a copy of the Memorandum and Order to the plaintiff at his last know address. Case Management Deadline set for 11/17/2006.Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. Copy mailed to the plaintiff as directed.(MKR )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER that by November 17, 2006 Plaintiff shall provide to the court copies of all charges and claims brought by the Plaintiff to the NEOC or EEOC and all Commission Determinations, Right to Sue Letters, or any other communications Plaintiff received from the NEOC or the EEOC. The Clerk of Court shall send a copy of the Memorandum and Order to the plaintiff at his last know address. Case Management Deadline set for 11/17/2006.Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. titleInfo.title: DeMonbrun v. Stevens Transport
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER regarding plaintiff's Response20 to the court's October 23, 2006 Memorandum and Order. the court is still unclear on the history of the case. Therefore, by November 17, 2006, the plaintiff is ordered to file with the court copies of all charges filed with any agency, and all documents it has received in response to charges filed with any agency. Absent a timely response to this order defendant's case is subject to dismissal without prejudice. Case Management Deadline set for 11/17/2006.Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (MKR )

titleInfo.title: DeMonbrun v. Stevens Transport
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff shall amend his complaint by 1/12/07. The Clerk shall mail a copy of this Memorandum and Order to plaintiff at his last-known address.Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. COPIES MAILED(JSF)

titleInfo.title: DeMonbrun v. Stevens Transport
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER- The defendant's motion to dismiss 11 is granted; and the Plaintiff's complaint is dismissed without prejudice. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (MKR )
